alert.note: Alert for Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 2:34PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Michigan... South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen affecting Ontonagon County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...South Branch Ontonagon near Ewen. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.5 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the M-28 bridge At 33.0 feet, The lumber yard near the M-28 bridge in Ewen begins to flood At 34.0 feet, Water flows over the east side of the M-28 bridge At 34.5 feet, The entire M-28 bridge is under water...with around a foot of water flowing over the east side of the bridge * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 PM EDT Wednesday, April 12 the stage was 30.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Friday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.
